paper_abstract: We propose cryptanalysis of the First Domingo-Ferrer's algebraic privacy homomorphism E: Z(n) -> (Zp x Zq)(d) where n = pq We show that the scheme can be broken by (d + 1) known plaintexts in O(d(3) log(2) n) time. Even when the modulus n is kept secret, it can be broken by 2(d + 1) known plaintexts in O(d(4) log dn + d(3) log(2) n + epsilon(m)) time with overwhelming probability. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Known-plaintext cryptanalysis of the Domingo-Ferrer algebraic privacy homomorphism scheme
